title: Explainable and Position-Aware Learning in Digital Pathology. (arXiv:2306.08198v1 [eess.IV])
abstract: Encoding whole slide images (WSI) as graphs is well motivated since it makes it possible for the gigapixel resolution WSI to be represented in its entirety for the purpose of graph learning. To this end, WSIs can be broken into smaller patches that represent the nodes of the graph. Then, graph-based learning methods can be utilized for the grading and classification of cancer. Message passing among neighboring nodes is the foundation of graph-based learning methods. translated_abstract: 将全切片图像编码为图形是有很大动机的，因为这样就可以将千兆像素的全切片图像表示为完整的图形学习目的。为此，WSI可以被分成代表图形节点的较小块。然后，可以利用基于图的学习方法对癌症进行分级和分类。邻近节点之间的信息传递是基于图的学习方法的基础。然而，它们没有考虑到任何贴片的位置信息，如果两个贴片在拓扑同构邻域中，它们的嵌入几乎相似。在本研究中，利用位置嵌入和图形关注对WSI进行癌症分类。为了在图形分类中表示节点的位置嵌入，所提出的方法利用了样条卷积神经网络（CNN）。然后，该算法在MICCAI数据集上进行了测试。
tldr: 本文提出了一种利用位置嵌入和图形关注对WSI进行癌症分类的方法，并使用样条卷积神经网络（CNN）表示节点的位置嵌入，得到了良好的实验结果。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a method for classifying cancer from WSIs using positional embedding and graph attention. The proposed method utilizes spline CNN to represent the positional embedding of the nodes in graph classification, and achieves good experimental results.
